intro: Hypochaeris macrorhiza, commonly known as the large-leafed sow thistle, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, fleshy leaves and yellow composite flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been introduced to other regions, including North America. It thrives in disturbed soils and can often be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Hypochaeris macrorhiza is an annual or biennial plant that is relatively easy to grow from seeds.
